Primary CTA Placement: Calculator inputs: instant results on change (no submit button). Results panel: 'Get Started' CTA with calculated value ('Save $X,XXX/year — Start Free'). Bottom: personalized CTA using calculator output. 'Email my results' as lead capture alternative.
Color Strategy: Light: Calculator: white card + subtle shadow on #F8FAFC bg. Sliders: brand-500 track. Results: green-500 for savings, brand-600 for your cost. Chart: brand/green palette. Dark: calculator: slate-800. Sliders: brand-400 track on slate-700. Results: green-400 savings. Chart: bright on dark.
Recommended Effects: Slider thumb drag interaction, real-time results counter animation, savings chart grow animation, comparison bar race animation, confetti on big savings, email results form animation, personalized CTA text morph
Animation Timing: Slider: real-time value update (no debounce). Results counter: 300ms morph on input change. Chart: bar grow 500ms on value change. Comparison: bar widths transition 400ms. Confetti: trigger when savings >$1000. CTA text: crossfade 200ms with new value.
Mobile Strategy: Calculator: stacked inputs (full-width sliders). Results: below calculator (stacked). Chart: simplified (numbers > charts on mobile). Sliders: large thumb (44px). CTA: full-width with calculated value. 'Email results': full-width form.
Dark Mode: Calculator card: slate-800. Sliders: brand-400 on slate-700. Results: green-400 savings. Chart: bright colors on dark. CTA: brand-400 with calculated value.
Accessibility: Sliders: role='slider' aria-valuemin/max/now. Results: aria-live='polite'. Chart: aria-label with values. Inputs: proper labels. CTA: descriptive text with calculated amount. Keyboard: slider arrow-key control.
Performance Impact: ⚡ Excellent. Lightweight JS for calculations. No framework needed. Charts: CSS-only bars. Sliders: native range inputs styled. Real-time: vanilla JS event listeners.
Conversion Optimization: Interactive calculators generate 2x more qualified leads than static content. Personalized savings amount in CTA = highest conversion. 'Email my results' captures leads without hard sell. Show specific numbers (not ranges). Default values should show impressive but realistic savings. A/B test: calculator position (hero vs below fold).
When NOT to Use: Don't use without accurate calculation logic. Avoid if savings are minimal (embarrassing). Not for products without measurable ROI. Skip if inputs are too complex (>5 sliders = abandonment).

Keywords: multi-product, platform, suite, ecosystem, product-family, hub, portfolio, solutions, integrated, all-in-one
Section Order: 1. Hero: platform vision + CTA → 2. Product grid/cards (each product as a card) → 3. Integration/connection visualization → 4. Use case scenarios → 5. Enterprise CTA + Individual product CTAs
Primary CTA Placement: Platform hero: 'Explore the platform'. Individual product cards: 'Learn more about [Product]'. Integration: 'See how they work together'. Use cases: 'Start with [use case]'. Enterprise: 'Contact Sales for platform pricing'. Each card links to product-specific landing.
Color Strategy: Light: Each product: distinct color within brand family (blue, purple, teal, orange). Platform: brand primary. Cards: white with colored top-border per product. Integration visual: connecting lines brand-500. Dark: products: colored accents on slate-800 cards. Integration lines: brand-400. Bg: slate-900.
Recommended Effects: Product card hover lift + color intensify, integration lines animate (connecting dots), use case tab switching, platform diagram build animation, product icon morph, ecosystem orbit animation
Animation Timing: Card hover: translateY(-4px) 200ms + border-top-color intensify. Integration lines: stroke-dashoffset draw on scroll 600ms. Tab switch: crossfade 200ms. Diagram: sequential node appear + line draw 100ms stagger. Orbit: 20s infinite rotation (subtle).
Mobile Strategy: Product cards: horizontal scroll or stacked. Integration: simplified diagram or list. Use cases: accordion. CTA: sticky bottom 'Explore Platform'. Each product card: full-width on mobile with icon + description.
Dark Mode: Platform: slate-900. Product cards: slate-800 with colored left-border. Integration: brand-400 lines on dark. Diagram: bright nodes on dark. Distinct but cohesive.
Accessibility: Product cards: role='article'. Integration diagram: aria-label description or data table alternative. Tabs: standard ARIA tab pattern. Diagram: fallback text description. Each product: accessible link.
Performance Impact: ⚡ Good. Static cards + minimal JS. Integration diagram: CSS/SVG. Tabs: lightweight. No heavy framework needed unless diagram is complex.
Conversion Optimization: Platform story > individual products. Show integration value ('better together'). Use cases: help visitors self-segment. Product cards: clear value prop per product. Enterprise: qualify leads for platform deals. Free tier: lower barrier to enter ecosystem. A/B test: platform-first vs product-first messaging.
When NOT to Use: Don't use for single-product companies. Avoid if products don't integrate well. Not for early-stage with <2 products. Skip if products serve completely different audiences.

Keywords: onboarding, activation, setup, wizard, getting-started, first-run, welcome, configuration, personalization, tutorial
Section Order: 1. Welcome step (personalization: name, role, goal) → 2. Setup step (connect accounts, import data) → 3. Quick win step (guided first action) → 4. Success celebration → 5. Dashboard redirect
Primary CTA Placement: Each step: 'Continue' primary CTA + 'Skip' secondary. Progress indicator: step dots or bar. Final: 'Go to Dashboard' CTA. Each step: contextual help. 'Skip' always available. Back button for corrections.
Color Strategy: Light: Clean white bg. Progress: brand-500 dots/bar. Active step: brand-50 card. Completed: green-500 check. Icons: brand-500. Success: green-500 celebration. Dark: slate-900 bg. Progress: brand-400. Cards: slate-800. Completed: green-400. Success: green-400 + confetti.
Recommended Effects: Step progress bar fill, card transition (slide-left), personalization option select animation, data import progress, quick-win guided highlight (tooltip pointer), success confetti + celebration, welcome name animation
Animation Timing: Progress: width transition 400ms ease. Card slide: 300ms slide-left + fade. Option select: scale 1→1.05→1 200ms + ring. Import progress: bar fill smooth. Guided highlight: pulse ring 2s on target element. Confetti: 500ms burst. Name: typewriter 400ms.
Mobile Strategy: Full-screen steps (one step per screen). Progress: top bar (thin). Steps: centered content, large touch targets. Skip: top-right corner. Continue: full-width bottom button. Swipe between steps option.
Dark Mode: Slate-900 bg. Progress: brand-400 on slate-700. Cards: slate-800. Options: brand-400 ring on select. Success: green-400 + confetti on dark. Welcoming dark theme.
Accessibility: Progress: role='progressbar'. Steps: aria-current='step'. Options: radio/checkbox groups. Skip: descriptive label. Success: aria-live announcement. Tab order: logical per step. Back: always available.
Performance Impact: ⚡ Excellent. Lightweight step logic. CSS transitions. No heavy framework needed. Progress: CSS. Confetti: lightweight lib or CSS.
Conversion Optimization: Onboarding determines activation rate. 3-5 steps max. Show value in step 3 (quick win). Personalization in step 1 increases completion 30%. Skip button reduces frustration. Progress indicator reduces abandonment 25%. Celebrate completion (dopamine hit). A/B test: with vs without personalization step.
When NOT to Use: Don't use as landing page (this is post-signup). Avoid >5 steps. Not for simple products that don't need setup. Skip personalization if it doesn't change the experience.

Keywords: seasonal, campaign, limited-time, holiday, sale, promotion, black-friday, launch-day, flash-sale, time-limited, special-offer
Section Order: 1. Hero: offer headline + countdown + CTA → 2. Deal highlights (what's included) → 3. Before/after pricing (crossed-out original) → 4. Urgency (limited stock / time) → 5. Social proof (recent purchases) → 6. Final CTA with countdown
Primary CTA Placement: Hero CTA: 'Claim Your Deal' (large, high-contrast). Sticky top bar: countdown + CTA. Bottom: final CTA repeating countdown. 'Recent purchase' toast notifications. Exit-intent popup (controversial but effective). Every CTA: shows deal value.
Color Strategy: Light: Urgency: red/orange accents. Countdown: red-500 on dark badges. Original price: grey strikethrough. Sale price: red-600 large. CTA: high-contrast (green-600 or brand-600). Savings badge: yellow/gold. Dark: countdown: red-400 on slate-800. Sale price: red-400. CTA: green-400 or brand-400. Gold savings badge.
Recommended Effects: Countdown timer (days:hours:min:sec), price strikethrough animation, savings badge pop-in, stock counter decrement, recent purchase toast (slide-in), confetti on CTA hover, urgency pulse on low stock, exit-intent popup slide-in
Animation Timing: Countdown: flip animation 500ms. Strikethrough: line draw 300ms. Savings badge: scale 0→1.1→1 300ms bounce. Stock counter: number morph 400ms on decrement. Toast: slide-in from bottom-right 300ms, auto-dismiss 5s. Exit popup: fade-in 200ms + scale 0.95→1. Confetti: 300ms on CTA hover.
Mobile Strategy: Countdown: compact horizontal (HH:MM:SS on mobile). Deal cards: stacked full-width. Sticky bottom bar: countdown + 'Claim Deal' CTA. Toast notifications: bottom bar on mobile. Pricing: large price, clear savings. Urgency: bold, above CTA.
Dark Mode: Countdown: red-400 on slate-800. Savings badge: amber-400. CTA: high-contrast green-400 or brand-400 on dark. Price: red-400 sale, slate-500 original. Toast: slate-800 card.
Accessibility: Countdown: aria-live='polite'. Toast: role='status'. Prices: aria-label with original and sale values. CTA: descriptive ('Claim 50% Off Deal'). Exit popup: focus-trap, escape-to-close. Strikethrough: CSS (not image).
Performance Impact: ⚡ Excellent. Countdown: lightweight JS. Toast: CSS animation. No heavy framework. Exit intent: minimal JS listener. Fast page load is critical (users are impatient during sales).
Conversion Optimization: Urgency + scarcity = highest conversion. Countdown creates 3x more conversions. Show savings amount AND percentage. Crossed-out original price is essential. Low stock warnings: effective but use honestly. Recent purchase toasts: social proof + urgency. Exit-intent: 10-15% recovery rate. A/B test: countdown position. Time-limit the campaign (real scarcity).
When NOT to Use: Don't use fake urgency (destroys trust). Avoid perpetual 'limited time' offers. Not for premium/luxury brands (sales cheapen perception). Skip exit-intent for mobile (annoying).
